intro: Tricalysia elmar, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. Tricalysia elmar is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. It thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
